answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Unintentional and unexplained weight loss of this magnitude is definitely not good. There are many causes like worms in stool, depression, anorexia nervosa, AIDS, cancers especially colon cancers, drug abuse, infections and loss of appetite. Loss of appetite can again be due to certain medications, drug abuse, depression, AIDS, acute and chronic infections, cancers and hypothyroidism. Either you do not eat well or there is increased metabolism as in hyperthyroid states, HIV, cancer etc. Poor absorption as in irritable bowel syndromes and malabsorption syndromes too is possible. Malabsorptin syndromes are seen in intestinal tuberculosis, HIV, tropical sprue, parasites in stool and Whipple’s Disease.I have enumerated the possibilities that come to my mind right now. Hope this helps. Please consult your gastroenterologist. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: My husband has loss about 60 lbs in the last 5 months.  The first 30 lbs was intentional, but now that he is trying to eat normally he can not stop losing.  The doctor has ruled out hyper thyroidism, diabetes,emphasima, prostate problems.  He has been going to a pain clinic and received some steriod treatment and radiological treatment for back and other pain.  What other test and causes could be causing this and could the pain treatment enter into this as he started at the pain clinic about the same time he started trying to loose weight?  He is down to 149 lbs and is weak and has no energy.  Also he is 73.  Thanks for your explanations.
title: unexplained weight loss
